title: Reminder that Sejuani's current pick and win rates are the lowest they've ever been
body:
Currently Sejuani holds a <46% winrate and a steadily declining play rate of <1% (champion.gg statistics), which is worse off than shes ever been as you can see with this site that shows champions past win/play rates https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/sejuani 

Sej has been nerfed into oblivion because of profession play and Riot hasnt made any statements on what they plan to do with this shell of a champion, with the last mention of the champion coming from Meddler almost 2 months ago when he said "I expect we'll give Sejuani some further work at some point post Worlds. Not sure on timing or details, but agree more's needed there." Complete radio silence after this vague comment. As a pre-rework Sejuani 1-trick this deeply disappoints me because not only did they completely change the way this champion functions, they seem to have no clue as to how to make this reworked Sejuani a fair and balanced champion. Even if a revert isn't in store for Sejuani, can we at least have some insight into Riot's plan for this champion? Thank you for reading, looking forward to hearing anything at all about Sej.

It's a bad thing because diversity is crucial for a game such as this where the only true difference between each match are the champions played and who plays them. Regardless of whether or not you dislike a champion, every champion should be balanced and appealing for their own uses. When only 50 out of 144 champions are getting picked as meta champions, the game stagnates resulting in a meta, which eventually boils down to who does the job better. By making more champions viable, the game becomes more enjoyable and balance is possible.
diversity doesn't matter when 90% of the roster has overlapping roles and don't offer anything new or unique to the game beyond previously not being picked

I beg to differ. Sure roles overlap and their purposes can be similar, but the way they work and do their job can vastly differ. Volibear, Skarner, and Rammus are all disruptors/tanks with CC and damage. They run into teamfights, pick somebody off with a decent focused amount of damage, throwing the enemy team off their balance. Possibly stopping a carry from doing their job, causing other champions to become distracted while others engage. However, they all differ. Volibear you have to work out getting too close to him and being thrown off, he can move to your backline swiftly and he will take lots of damage. Skarner is similar, but he may decide to grab a tank and run off with them, even though it was only a tank, you can quickly lose a fight as your team disperses and falls apart, but he may also decide to provide constant CC with his E and distract carries and tanks alike. Rammus can help hunt down enemies quickly, but is not so good in fights as he can be blocked, but he still provides taunts and decent AoE.

I don't think many champions are similar like this, they all have key parts of their kit that make them special for their own purpose and especially their own matchups. However, even in situations like this where champions are similar in style, they have plenty of minute details and styles that make them special.

Regardless of all of that, even if champions are similar, I at least rather see someone different most every game considering the size of the rooster. Seeing the same 3 ADCs, junglers, top laners, supports, mid laners, etc. is desensitizing. And it starts to feel like every match plays out like the previous one. Having a balanced rooster would add more flavor to this game. I miss the old days of playing against a different champion and having to think about what to do to win lane or a fight. Now though, I see Lucian/Jhin/Kai'sai for the 10th time in a row and I've decided before the game even starts that me and my adc will be farming under tower because that's our best bet.

I'd actually argue that it's kind of a bad thing high elo Sejuani players have a decently high winrate with her, it just shows how much coordination is needed in order to utilize her kit properly. According to lolalytics.com, Sejuani sits at a 54.5% winrate in Master+ while if you look at the next lowest skill level of Diamond+ she already drops to 44.3% winrate. That drop is huge and indicates that even with a bit less coordination, Sejuani's impact on the game drops dramatically. Sej is just so gated by the need to have a reliable team that she feels terrible to play in solo queue and she needs some fundamental kit changes so that she is able to do things on her own easier and isn't broken with a coordinated team.

Sej is a team oriented champ, there is no getting around that. Not to mention pure tanks like Sej are out of meta. As for Trundle he kind made his staple as an anti-tank tank (because of ult), with tanks out of meta he was bound to fall to. I'm sure/hope Riot brings tanks back to equal footing in the preseason.
Only Sejunai and leona are the only tanks that are this team dependant. The rest can use their kits to the fullest without them
Meanwhile Leona can still absolutely stomp lower ratings in good hands because she directly spoonfeeds the ADC for half the game. Sej's main weakness is being a jungler.

Wouldn't say that because she's always been a jungler. Her new kit is primarily the problem as it's overloaded with CC and has had her nerfed into the ground.
I mean, season 5 sejuani was probably the strongest tank in history until she was nerfed

Lets be honest, trundle was broken af as a melee jungler. Fast clear, sustain, good dueling power 1v1, 2v2 AND in teamfights. Good early, good mid (with triforce) and good late (if you ult enemy tank). Only weakness for me here is that he is kite-able, but he even has a big slow with his pillar and a movement speed buff to close the gap. So imo he SHOULD be gutted.

He wasn't broken he was just really good in a meta where damage was too high because he has strong survival inherent to his kit (AD stealing on Q paired with sustain).  During that time he was mostly dueling other bruisers, and aside from tank busting he is one of the best duelists in the game.  He pays for that by being extremely easy to kite, able to simply walk out of his ult, and having really no way to chase any mobile target.

It's not even all tanks that are bad against him, HP stacking ones instead of armor or magic resist do just fine.  There are also more than a couple of bruisers who can give him trouble including Udyr.

I know I know... you probably have heard all this before, but I like Trundle and he goes through a roller coaster ride of nerfs/buffs every season.  At a base level I feel he is necessary for the game (particularly if tanks get out of control) and he's fun to play.  When I see people get frustrated about Trundle you are really talking about all the same things Nasus can do, but no one is turning around to say how frustrating Nasus is despite having stronger sustain with Q, a gigantic slow, and an ult which makes anyone unable to duel him 1v1.  They both have the same big weakness, and I feel the power they have is the correct amount to make up for that.
